Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Doppler Microvascular Ultrasound in Skull Base Surgery

Participants.evidence: 56 patients who underwent skull base tumor resection with MVD assistance at the Department of Neurosurgery, First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

Intervention.evidence: MVD was employed to monitor blood flow in vessels adjacent to the tumors.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of Doppler microvascular ultrasound (MVD) in enhancing intraoperative assessment and protection of arterial blood flow during skull base surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No intraoperative vascular injuries were observed, as confirmed by intraoperative Doppler monitoring and postoperative imaging.

Harms.evidence: No intraoperative vascular injuries were observed, as confirmed by intraoperative Doppler monitoring and postoperative imaging.
